page.title: 03FELMERSHAM
page.content:
The village of {Felmersham}grew up to the south of one of the many crossing points of the River Great Ouse. There was a settlement here in Saxon times and it is mentioned in the Domesday Book. The most distinctive building in the village is the church, built on a rise overlooking the river and bridge.
The building is Early English in style and exceptionally impressive. Much of the work dates from the 15th century including the screen.
Close to the church is the Tithe Barn, restored a few years ago and this faces the village green, now a feature of the area having also been restored.
